items.answer: A motor vehicle expert prepares reports in the event of vehicle damage, assesses the extent of the damage, and documents everything in a legally sound manner. This provides you with the basis to assert your claim against the insurance company.
items.question: What does a motor vehicle expert do?

items.answer: An appraisal is necessary for: liability damages (e.g., accident with third-party fault), comprehensive damages (own fault), vehicle appraisals for sale or end of leasing.
items.question: When do I need a motor vehicle appraisal?

items.answer: The cost of a motor vehicle appraisal depends on the extent of the damage. In the case of accidents not caused by you, the opposing insurance company usually covers the costs.
items.question: What does a motor vehicle appraisal cost?

items.answer: Our motor vehicle experts in {cityName} prepare reports within 24 hours after the vehicle inspection.
items.question: How quickly will I receive my report?

items.answer: An independent report protects you from reductions by insurance companies and ensures that you receive fair compensation.
items.question: Why is an independent report important?
